name: Security Version Number Mutable to Older Versions
description: Security-version number in hardware is mutable, resulting in the ability to downgrade (roll-back) the boot firmware to vulnerable code versions.

x_mitre_content_history.submission_name: Arun Kanuparthi, Hareesh Khattri, Parbati Kumar Manna

x_mitre_detection_methods.description: Mutability of stored security version numbers and programming with older firmware images should be part of automated testing.
Anti-roll-back features should be reviewed as part of Architecture or Design review.

x_mitre_potential_mitigations.description: When architecting the system, security version data should be designated for storage in registers that are either read-only or have access controls that prevent modification by an untrusted agent.
During implementation and test, security version data should be demonstrated to be read-only and access controls should be validated.
